title: Practice Makes Perfect Algebra I - + Workbook 2/e (gnv64)
description: Practice Makes Perfect Algebra I - Review and Workbook (2nd Ed) by Carolyn Wheater McGraw-Hill Education | January 2018 | ISBN: 978-1-26-002645-0 | ePUB | 19.9 mb This book will help you develop skills in algebra. Inside are numerous lessons to help you better understand the subject. These lessons are accompanied by hundreds of exercises to practice what you’ve learned, along with a complete answer key to check your work. Throughout this book you will learn the terms to help you understand algebra, and you will expand your knowledge of the subject through dozens of sample problems and their solutions. With the lessons in this book, you will find it easier than ever to grasp concepts in algebra. And with a variety of exercises for practice, you will gain confidence using your growing algebra skills in your classwork and on exams. About the Author Carolyn Wheater has taught mathematics for 30 years and currently teaches at the Nightingale-Bamford School in New York City. She is a member of National Council of Teachers of Mathematics and the Association of Teachers in Independent Schools. CONTENTS Introduction 1 Arithmetic to algebra 2 Linear equations 3 Linear inequalities 4 Coordinate graphing 5 Systems of linear equations and inequalities 6 Powers and polynomials 7 Factoring 8 Radicals 9 Quadratic equations and their graphs 10 Proportion and variation 11 Rational equations and their graphs 12 Exponential growth and decay 13 Matrix algebra 14 Problem solving Answers https://s17.postimg.org/8joulpa1r/cover.jpg
